text: It's a cool backstreet with lots of wall art and a lack of people but it's incredibly hot with the extractors from the rear of the restaurants on the roads on either side so prepare to smell like food and come out ten degrees hotter than before.
Walking around Muscat Street, Kandahar Street and Bussorah Street, we found some colourfully painted walls and trash bins. Great place to take photos! Unfortunately it was raining while I was there.

Lucked up and found this amazing outdoor art gallery in Kampong Glam. If you go early enough you can get the place to yourself. It is actually on Muscat Street and not Arab Street as shown on Google Maps.
Cool place for instagram if you‚Äôre bored with the haji lane. You can easily find turkish restaurants. The feel was so middle eastern-ish.
Fantastic hidden street gallery (across two parallel streets), clever and rejuvenating street art, full of character. Thank you for creating this great little gem üëåüèª
